revised_title: The Emission Band Spectrum of Chlorine: Part I
tldr: This article presents a study of the emission band spectrum of chlorine, focusing on the effects of various excitation conditions, such as pressure, electrical discharge, and external temperature. The authors analyze the chlorine spectrum using spectrographs and discuss the influence of different conditions on the production of bands and atomic lines. They also examine the effect of cooling the discharge tube and the role of isotopes in the spectrum.
